column4: Hey guys! I got a bit of a problem. I'm trying to install Ubuntu on a P5Q Deluxe motherboard(not on the actual board). But I seem to have hit a snag when it's searching for devices. It stops at 50% and then stays there for 20 seconds. Then the whole computer just freezes. Any help would be appricated
Is there someone that might be able to help me?
best to just ask the channel your question
I actually did, it was rather neglected :)
did you 'check the cd for defects' from the CD's boot menu?
Yea, I tried it once when the disc was brand new. No problemos, and once after i've tried to install it. Then I had one error. But i've tried different versions and maybe 3-4 cd/dvds
if you get errors on the "check CD for defects", you can't use the CD to install.  Try burning at 2x speed
Yea I get that. But I have like two other ones that doesnt have any defects. But still doesn't install.
I've tried 8.04 LTS x64 and 8.10 beta x64
k, they're just called desktop CDs.  Did you try the alternate cd to see if was any better?
That's the only thing I haven't done yet.
I guess i'll give it a try
that seems to work, got through the 'search device' thing
